Every business day, our federal government prints over 1,000 copies of The Federal Register, even though this document has been available online – without charge – for 25 years. Every copy is roughly 300 pages and costs $4.50 per copy to print and distribute. That’s around $1 million of taxpayer money annually.  In other words, the U.S. federal government basically lights $1 million of taxpayer money on fire every single year. It’s completely ridiculous that the government is wasting resources and time printing a 300-page book every day that never gets used. America is leading the world in technological advancement and internet capability. It’s time for government agencies to get up to speed.  Senator Sheldon Whitehouse and I are introducing a bipartisan plan to end the wasteful automatic printing of this document. It’s a good start, and Congress should use this bipartisan, commonsense approach to get after wasteful spending across the entire federal government.
